video.title: Full Stack Web Development for Beginners (Full Course on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, MongoDB)
video.description:
Learn full-stack web development in this full course for beginners. First, you will learn the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Then, you will learn how to put everything together to create a frontend movie search app. Finally, you will learn how to create a backend API to create movie reviews and connect the frontend to the backend. The backend uses Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.

🔗 Get started with Replit: https://join.replit.com/web-students

✏️ Tomi Tokko and Beau Carnes developed this course. 
Tomi's channel: https://www.youtube.com/CodeWithTomi
Beau's channel: https://www.youtube.com/zizyo

⭐️ Code ⭐️
JavaScript RPG Starter: https://replit.com/@BeauCarnes/JavaScript-RPG-Starter
JavaScript RPG Complete: https://replit.com/@BeauCarnes/JavaScript-RPG

Frontend Movie App (and starter for connecting to backend): https://replit.com/@TomiTokko/MoviesApp
Live demo of frontend app: https://moviesapp.tomitokko.repl.co/ 

Backend Reviews API: https://replit.com/@BeauCarnes/review-backend
Frontend connected to backend: https://replit.com/@BeauCarnes/htmlfrontend

🏗 Replit provided a grant to make this course possible.

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:02:42) Learn HTML
⌨️ (1:26:27) Learn CSS
⌨️ (3:15:49) Learn JavaScript
⌨️ (4:52:01) Create Frontend Movie App
⌨️ (5:44:04) Create Backend Reviews API
⌨️ (6:49:32) Connect Frontend with Backend

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Nattira Maneerat
👾 Heather Wcislo
👾 Serhiy Kalinets
👾 Erdeniz Unvan
👾 Justin Hual
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 Otis Morgan

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Kyle Givler
topLevelComment.text:
5:20:00 very disappointed to see the API key in the script file... And no warning that you should never do this, you should protect your API keys and you should never check them into source control. This is addressed later at 6:00:00 but I think its important to have people thinking about security and secrets from the start of their coding journey.

It was also super weird to see the center tag being used, its not even valid html5.

Also thank you, its always good to have free web dev content, appreciate the effort of everyone at freeCodeCamp

topLevelComment.author: Inspisia Videos
topLevelComment.text:
anyone, please help with this case of mine:
I’ve graduated in CS last year and since then got an internship that got extended to 8 months and 2 contract jobs, one part time and another one full time but after this past July haven’t gotten anything. I was forced to work in customer service but kept applying every single day and practicing as well. Just last week a hospital gave me the “yes” after 4 interviews as Web Developer in JS but I’ll also see php, wordpress, drupal from some of their sites, SQL and work on integrations. Yesterday I had a meeting with HR and webt through benefits and all that but when it came to salary they offered 85k. No bonus. I asked if there was room to negotiate, they said yes, then I asked if they can meet me in the middle between 92 to 100k. He told me he’ll speak to others in the company and will let me know and after that he’ll send me some other links for me to fill out. They didn’t reach out to me today, and I’m beginning to worry. I haven’t contacted them yet though. I feel what I asked was reasonable and I was very polite all the time. What do you think? If they do reach back out but said that’s their final offer, as much as I’d want more money I will accept the original offer but how can I say it without losing face and keep some dignity? Should I reach out again, asking the HR guy some other questions related to work and see what happens? For full context, I live in Massachusetts so I still think asking for a little bit of money was reasonable because they want people with experience and I nailed all tech questions and passed their code test but I’m beginning to grow nervous they would ghost me. I mean, I have to take it because my mom had a surgery (they removed her uterus just this month after losing too much blood) and me and my sister are the ones taking care of her. Please let me know. Thanks

replies.author: Lonny Bulldozer
replies.text: @Anthony Lopez They consistently put up several-hour long tutorials from people with no real-world experience and spread bad practices. Many of these "instructors" are simply reading documentation to you, and attempting to pass themselves off as experts of professionals. In reality, they have no idea what they're doing. It has become clear the goal of the channel is to keep you watching for as long as possible (ad revenue), rather than to provide useful content. Also, they have an agenda. Take it easy, Anthony.
